name: Goldstar Resort & Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Goldstar Resort and Suites in Nice is a fine hotel. I booked via 1800hotels.com. I got a terrific rate, of 177 US, prepaid but including breakfast. This compared very favorably with the 250 euros or so that was posted in the hotel and with rates for similar hotels in the area of Nice where we stayed—a couple of blocks off the Promenade des Anglais and in the downtown area.
reviews.title: Goldstar in Nice a great value, just don't park there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I’m guessing that the hotel is Russian owned, because that’s what the folks at the front desk appeared to be speaking to each other. Russian was also the first language listed among the 4 translations used for signage in the hotel and there is a large Russian population in Nice overall. That assumed, the décor was predominately Asian with full-size terra cotta warriors at various places in the halls and public rooms.
reviews.title: Spa??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What was really wonderful about the hotel—besides its reasonable price, good location, and overall cleanliness and classy décor—was its rooms. It’s apparently an all suite hotel, with rooms that feature separate living rooms with desk, chair, and sleeper sofa. The toilet and bidet were separate from the tub/shower vanity area and there was even a highly compact little kitchen facility with frig, cooktop, sink and dishwasher (in about a square yard of space, amazingly laid out). Everything was polished marble from the floors to the walls and very streamlined and modern. It was great—and again, at an incredibly reasonable rate.
reviews.title: Large 5 star apartment suites at 3 star prices in Nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was served in the hotel restaurant space which had small decks holding two tables each where you could take your breakfast while enjoying the lovely Nice climate. The breakfast was ample and included the usual selections we’d had other places plus scrambled eggs and bacon. The restaurant/breakfast room was large but broken up into a couple of areas, showed evidence of sound machines for dancing or just loud music and even had an area with raked sand. Quirky but kind of fun.
reviews.title: chaotic service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a pool and sunning area one floor up from the restaurant and probably a workout room. I never checked out any of this but my husband looked and assured me it was there. I know they had a computer and wifi for guest use since I used it each day.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our third trip to Nice and the best location we've had. Barely five minutes from the Promenade des Anglais, five minutes from Place Massena and the shopping district.
reviews.title: Excellent in every respect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and spoke enough english for us. We booked a junior suite, but were upgraded to a Consul suite, which was superb and immaculately clean.
reviews.title: After 2 disappointing nights in Radisson & West End, we felt so relieved to find Goldstar & stayed a week there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was very firm, but not a problem for us. The kitchenette small but perfectly functional and very clean (cups were tiny though - had to buy a couple of mugs for tea!)
reviews.title: Great Room - Service? Typically French

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comfiest sofa I've ever sat on in a hotel room. Two TVs!
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel and friendly staff!!!!
What a let down!
reviews.text: The bathroom was exceptional - double sinks and huge bath/shower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I work at the luxury end of the travel industry and was really impressed with this hotel. which is great for what it is. I was originally booked into the Hermitage in Monaco, a super luxury Belle-Epoque hotel, then thought the better of the cost! I chose the Goldstar Resort & Suites instead because for a fraction of the amount I could stay in a suite (a proper one with a seperate lounge) instead of a small room, and with its central location a 5-6 minute walk from the train station, I could catch a train to Moncaco (20 mins) with ease. The hotel has a small pool and gym which cover the essentials and although it doesn't have a sophisticated concierge like my original choice, I'd done my homework about restaurants and the receptionist helped me to book them when asked. The breakfast was small but perfectly formed - at Euros 20 it was quite expensive by UK standards but this is normal for hotels in France. A previous reviewer complained about the croissants - I thought they were fantastic. There are plenty of cheap breakfast places on the nearby seafront for variation and there's always the kitchenette in the room to store croissants etc if you're really trying to save some money. The lounge area was a very good size and the decor of the rooms is modern and stylish. All in all this is an excellent value, stylish hotel (the pictures on the website are a good representation) in a great location and I would definately recommend it. Those who prefer vast American buffet breakfasts, VIP concierge services, deluxe spas and 20 English language channels on the TV should stay at one the of the grand 5 star hotels instead, and pay more for a smaller room.
reviews.title: Really enjoyed my stay at Goldstar Resort

likes.liked: — Great value and nicely decorated suites
likes.disliked: — A few random wooden Toucans which did not go with the rest of the great decor!

reviews.text: I picked this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor. Some pluses about the hotel: (1) great layout. there's pocket doors between the entrance and living room, and between the living room and bedroom, so that you can close off the rooms. this was convenient when i stayed behind at night with our 18 month daughter and my husband strolled around the neighborhood. (2) the people at the reception speak excellent english and extremely helpful. Some minuses: (1) we got a room on the 3rd floor (there are 6 floors). even though the windows are double-pane, we could still hear the cars and motorbikes on the road. probably staying on the higher floor will help. (2) the walls are not well insulated so you can hear your neighbor walking. this is probably typical of any new construction so I can't blame the hotel. (3) our bathroom (the tub) had some mold. it wasn't a whole lot, but enough to bother me. again, probably something you will find in any hotel. Although I'm not sure I would stay here the next time, overall, I would recommend this hotel - especially for families since you can have some privacy. Meyerbeer street has a lot of food and small grocery stores. The hotel is about 3 blocks from the promenade.
reviews.title: Above average - not as great as I expected

likes.liked: — Pocket doors allow you to close off the rooms.

reviews.text: We booked this hotel as we struggled to find a 4• hotel in the centre of Nice which would accomodate our 4 year old son in the same room as my husband & I. All of the other web sites we used, offered double rooms only and could not confirm an extra bed in our room but suggested we book the room with them and take our chances by requesting a camp bed for our son when we checked in. I was not prepared to do this, and was lucky to have found this hotel on Trip Advisor.
reviews.title: Excellent for Families with Children

likes.liked: — Size of room and quality of finish
likes.disliked: — price of drinks in hotel bar

reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights from 3rd to 5th of July, in a room with a large marble bathroom and a separate living area with small kitchen. Perfect for families.
reviews.title: Disappointing-Air Con didn't work,Service not up to much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel had a covered roof top pool which my son loved and sun loungers which my husband and I loved.
reviews.title: average breakfast

likes.liked: — the pool on the top of the building
likes.disliked: — the breafast and not towels available at the spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I kicked off our honeymoon by staying here. Like others, we were upgraded to the Consul Suite which was very comfortable - an enormous bathroom and a very comfortable (but firm) bed. It rained the whole time we were there so I can't really comment on the rooftop pool or terrace, but they looked lovely! Brunch was great - a nice spread of breakfast meats, fruits, and pastries. Hotel staff was courteous and almost everyone spoke English. Although the hotel was full, we barely saw or heard another person during our entire 3-day stay. The location was fantastic - set a few blocks back from the Promenade des Anglais and in New Nice, but a great location for walking anywhere. We feel we were able to see a lot of Nice because of where we stayed. We also rented a car and it was easy to find via the A-8 Autoroute. Just a few blocks from the beach! We liked the location because it was set back from the hustle and bustle of the Promenade but we were close enough to be there in a few steps. I don't think we had a single complaint about this hotel, it was really a wonderful stay!
reviews.title: Very comfy hotel, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Goldstar was ruined by an incident on our first night ! At 3.30 in the morning we were confronted with a strange half naked man stumbling around in our room … he had somehow managed to get into our room even though the electronic key cards should prevent this. As you can imagine, this scared the living daylights out of us. We immediately reported it to the reception desk. The following day we went to the reception desk and they advised this had never happened before and we obviously hadn't shut the door properly … as this wasn't a satisfactory response we went back the following day, when this time we were told the electrical fault (??) had now been fixed and it wouldn't happen again, but the manager was not around to speak to until the following day. Unfortunately, this is where the hotel management let us down as they weren't even apologetic and didn't seem to care. As we weren't flying until later that evening, they did finally agree to an extension of 3 hours after the original check out time.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, good location - only ruined by incident on our first night !
Large modern rooms
reviews.text: Had the above not happened then we would have enjoyed our stay there - it was a great location from the Promenade des Anglais, the old town and the shopping district. We had booked a junior suite but were upgraded to a Consul suite - on reading other reviews, this seems to happen a lot !

The suite was very spacious, with a huge wet room for the shower (but no bath). The bed was very comfortable and there was plenty of wardrobe space. The swimming pool was lovely and heated at 34 degrees. There was a good choice at breakfast of bacon/eggs, cereal, pastries, cold meats/cheese and fruit/yoghurts and you could have as much as you liked.
reviews.title: Not Very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are a couple of other points but not enough to ruin our stay:
reviews.title: Very nice!

description: The Goldstar is a 4-star hotel located in central Nice, just 2 minutes from the Promenade des Anglais. It features a heated swimming pool and a rooftop terrace.
